Marylynn Gelderman |choreographer= |formerchoreographer= |skating club= |retired= 1998 }} '''Jason Dungjen''' (born September 27, 1967) is an [[United States|American]] retired [[Pair skating|pair skater]] who was a two-time U.S. national champion. He is currently a skating coach. Dungjen competed first with his sister [[Susan Dungjen]], with whom he won a silver medal at the 1984 [[World Junior Figure Skating Championships|World Junior Championships]]. After that, he competed with [[Kyoko Ina]]. They were the [[1997 United States Figure Skating Championships|1997]] and [[1998 United States Figure Skating Championships|US National champions]] and placed fourth at the 1998 Winter Olympics. Their partnership dissolved after the 1997-1998 season and he retired from competition. He married [[Yuka Sato]] in 1999. They skated together on the [[Stars on Ice]] tour. Dungjen is currently a coach at the Detroit Skating Club in [[Bloomfield Hills, Michigan]]. In collaboration with his wife, he is the coach of [[Alissa Czisny]]. In June 2011, he began coaching [[Adam Rippon]]. Dungjen is also an ISU Technical Specialist for the United States. ==Competitive highlights== (with Ina) {| class="wikitable" |- !
